title: I have been playing viola for about six years and have never gotten a viola hickey. Why am I getting one now? - Quora

response.answer_text: They are generlly thought to be cused by sweat mixing with rosin, and pressure. I don’t sweat much so mostly I just have a callous you can barely see. Now that you have one it is hard to get rid of them, as with all pressure sores. Keep some clean silk or cotton handkerchiefs in your pocket and rotate to a new, dry one often while playing. For men, beard hair follicles can get inflamed. If it gets really bad you may have to take a break while it heals. Good luck.
Your viola has been shy all these years.
